This KankuFile downloads the openSUSE Leap 15.6 image
from devel:kanku:images and installs/configures 

* icinga2
* icingaweb2
* mariadb
* graphana

This KankuFile creates a VM based on openSUSE Leap 15.6 dki image
Finally it installs salt-master and salt-minion

domain_name needs to be `salt`.
Mnions try to connect salt.their.domain.com in the default
configuration, so no additional configuration required on the minion.

This KankuFile is an example how to install multiple VM's in one KankuFile

The following VM's are create:

* kanku-vm1
* kanku-vm2

Use `kanku destroy` to delete the first VM (kanku-vm1).
You can delete both machines at once by executing
#
# kanku up -j clean --skip_check_domain
#

This KankuFile creates a VM based on dki tumbleweed with ext4.
After booting it installs and configures kanku (dev mode).
Then a KankuFile using the configured default box is created (`kanku init ...`).
Last but not least `kanku up` is executed.
